benchmark_details.name: FanChuan: A Multilingual and Graph-Structured Benchmark For Parody Detection and Analysis
benchmark_details.overview: FanChuan is designed to address parody detection in social media by providing diverse datasets enriched with contextual information through user-interaction graphs. It contains a total of 21,210 annotated comments and 14,755 annotated users, facilitating comprehensive experiments in parody detection, comment sentiment analysis, and user sentiment analysis.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive benchmark for studying parody detection and analysis in multilingual contexts, leveraging user-interaction data and contextual information.

data.source: Seven datasets collected from various social media platforms in both English and Chinese.
data.annotation: Annotated by native speakers with the help of expert judges and refined using Large Language Models.

methodology.calculation: F1 scores for evaluating parody detection and sentiment classification tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores indicate better model performance in detecting parody and classifying sentiments.
methodology.baseline_results: Traditional methods often outperform advanced LLMs in parody detection.
methodology.validation: Models evaluated across multiple datasets with consistent performance metrics.

harm: Misunderstanding cultural contexts in parody texts

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: User-sensitive content removed; the dataset does not include any personally identifiable information.
